body.p: The default publication comes with two doctypes:

The Simple Doctype is typically used for situations when you want control over what information has to be included in a document. The Simple Document defines a set of tags that a document has to be comprised of.

The XHTML Doctype on the other hand is for situations where users ask for complete freedom on what information can be inserted into a document. While this approach doesn't restrict you, it also looses some of the major benefits of well defined document types.
